item.title: Skye Boat Song
item.author: Harish V
item.description:
This is an attempt to play the popular Skye Boat Song. It is a traditional piece and recently there is a Skye Boat Song from the popular British TV series Outlander.

This piece is played in the key of D major.

Cheers,
V.Harish

item.title: Minuet in G
item.author: Harish V
item.description:
This is an attempt to play the popular Minuet in G by Johann Sebastian Bach. As suggested by the title, this piece is played in the key of G major.

Cheers,
V.Harish

item.title: The Elephant (Cover)
item.author: Harish V
item.description:
An attempt to play the popular piece, “The Elephant” from the Carnival of the Animals on keyboard (transposed) in Piano mode.

Cheers,
Harish

item.title: Greensleeves
item.author: Harish V
item.description:
This is a small attempt to play the popular English folk song Greensleeves (Played in Dmin Key with Time Signature of 3/4) on my keyboard! :)

If the above player does not work, see below for the SoundCloud embed.

Greensleeves (Melody)

Greensleeves with Chords

Greensleeves with Rhythm

Cheers,
Harish

item.title: Kabhi Jo Baadal Barse - Jackpot
item.author: Harish V
item.description:
Here is an easy-to-sing-and-strum version of the song Kabhi Jo Baadal Barse from movie Jackpot.

Original key is in C-minor. Put a capo on the 3rd fret of your Guitar and play with the simple chords below.

Chords used: Am, G, F, Dm, Em

KABHI JO BAADAL BARSE - JACKPOT

C MINOR KEY - CAPO 3

Thank you. Your comments are most welcome.

Inspired from: Guitar Chord World

(Refer to above link for Original Chords and a Capo 1 Version of the song)

item.title: Boulevard of Broken Dreams - Green Day
item.author: Harish V
item.description:
Boulevard of Broken Dreams by Green Day - Guitar Chords

Here is the basic chord strumming for the song. Sing and strum along!

Remember to use a capo on the 1st fret of the guitar

Chords Required (in sequence): E(minor), G(major), D(major), A(minor)

Strumming Pattern: D D U (change chord now) D D U (change) ...

Repeat the above for the entire song.

It’s that simple! :D

Refer to video if unsure: Link to YouTube

Credits

  • http://www.guitar-skill-builder.com/free-printable-guitar-chord-chart.html
  • Credit: http://www.guitar-skill-builder.com/free-printable-guitar-chord-chart.html
